title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox wore a bloodied Jacqueline Kennedy costume, claiming it's a statement, not just a Halloween outfit.
Jack Schlossberg criticized Fox's costume as 'disgusting' and accused her of glorifying political violence.
Fox defended the outfit, highlighting Jackie Kennedy's act of wearing blood-stained clothes to reveal the brutality of assassination.

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr. and WR Drake London will play against the Patriots after injuries in Week 8.
Penix and London were full participants in Friday's practice, signaling their return for Week 9 in Foxborough.
Falcons face a 6-2 Patriots team on a five-game win streak, looking to end their own two-game skid.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow believes the Red Sox are better positioned to acquire key players after making the playoffs in 2025.
The Red Sox face potential roster gaps with Alex Bregman and others considering contract options this offseason.
Boston is $25 million under the luxury tax threshold and boasts a strong farm system, aiding their offseason plans.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel dismisses claims that his changes to Patriot traditions aim to distance from past successes.
Vrabel introduced individual offensive starters in Week 8, breaking a 24-year team introduction tradition.
Despite modifications, the Patriots lead the AFC East with a 6-2 record under Vrabel's leadership.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm is expected to miss several weeks for the Bruins due to a lower-body injury sustained against the Sabres.
Marat Khusnutdinov is promoted to Bruins' first-line center alongside David Pastrnak and Morgan Geekie.
Lindholm, who scored four power-play goals this season, will undergo an MRI to assess the injury's severity.

title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Thousands of tourists visited Salem, Massachusetts for Halloween 2025, flooding the streets in costume for the annual festivities.
Popular attractions included the Haunted Happenings Marketplace and the Salem Witch Museum, drawing large crowds throughout the day.
Visitors engaged in various activities, from trick-or-treating to participating in a Witches’ Circle at the Salem Common.

title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Rep. Seth Moulton accused President Trump of abusing girls with Jeffrey Epstein during a tense MSNBC interview.
Moulton, offering no proof, claimed it's 'obvious' Trump is in Epstein-related files, sparking disagreement with host Joe Scarborough.
Moulton's comments come amid his challenge to Sen. Ed Markey in the 2026 Democratic primary.

title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Brian Walshe's next competency hearing is set for November 14, with jury selection starting November 18.
Judge Krupp ordered preservation of cellphone evidence in the ongoing Karen Read case, involving several defendants.
Defense attorneys received permission to review Michael Proctor's cellphone data, which contains sensitive information.

title: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Star Market on the Mass. Pike reopened after a three-day closure due to an asbestos scare.
Inspectors confirmed the asbestos was contained in the stockroom, posing no risk to customers.
The Massachusetts DEP ensured that air and surface samples in the store showed no asbestos presence.

title: ‘He has everything to score 50’: Morgan Geekie is evolving into an elite goal scorer for Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Morgan Geekie is on pace for 57 goals this season, leading the Bruins with his powerful shot.
David Pastrnak praises Geekie, stating his shot is the best on the team and possesses goal-scorer instincts.
Geekie has scored in six consecutive games, showcasing his effectiveness on power plays under new coaching strategies.
